cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 560 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north then north-northeast and tracking toward the northern Gulf Coast of Louisiana–Mississippi, with the center expected to cross southeastern Louisiana and move inland toward the Mississippi/Alabama border
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near or just south of New Orleans (between Morgan City and the mouth of the Mississippi River)

weather_observation.under_watch: None (port is in the warning area)
weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning – Morgan City LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and metropolitan New Orleans; Storm Surge Warning – Intracoastal City LA to Navarre FL including Lake Borgne, Lake Pontchartrain, Vermilion Bay, Pensacola Bay and Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds are likely by Wednesday afternoon with a 65% chance; hurricane-force gusts (up to Category 1) are possible near landfall Wednesday evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 4–6 ft above normally dry ground is possible along the Plaquemines Parish coast and adjacent lakes/bays.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated totals to 6 inches could produce flash and urban flooding in and around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes are possible Wednesday and Wednesday night over southeast Louisiana including the Plaquemines Port District.
